title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 25)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Acton saw sales including 246 Main St. #6, a two-bedroom condo for $450,000.
Amesbury's 486 Main St., a one-family home with three bedrooms, sold for $880,000.
Boston's 1 Dalton St. #5301, a high-rise condo with four bedrooms, sold for $14,000,000.

title: How long will Mass. residents have to wait until their power is restored?
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Over 100,000 customers in Eastern Massachusetts are still without power following a blizzard on Monday.
Eversource and National Grid anticipate full power restoration may take until Wednesday night or later.
High winds and severe conditions delayed repair efforts, with Cape Cod and the Islands hardest hit by outages.

title: 15 prospects Patriots fans should know entering the 2026 NFL Combine
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots hold 11 picks, including 31st overall, for 2026 NFL Draft to address depth chart gaps.
Wide receiver KC Concepcion and edge rusher Zion Young are notable prospects for Patriots' offensive and defensive upgrades.
Offensive tackle Kadyn Proctor's athleticism could boost his draft stock and appeal to Patriots for future strategy.

title: Malden school employee on leave after alleged ‘serious incident’ involving high school student
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A Malden school employee is on leave after a 'serious incident' with a high school student.
The alleged incident, occurring outside working hours, is under investigation by Malden police.
The employee works at Linden STEAM Academy; no arrests or charges have been made yet.

title: These Mass. schools are closed for Wednesday, Feb. 25
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massachusetts school districts on the South Coast and South Shore remain closed due to a historic snowstorm.
The storm dropped up to three feet of snow, affecting several areas with school closures for a third day.
Closed districts include Brockton, Quincy, and Plymouth; delayed start reported for Canton, Walpole, and Wrentham.

title: MBTA to (mostly) resume normal weekday service after historic blizzard
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA to resume regular weekday service Wednesday except modified schedule on Fall River/New Bedford Commuter Rail line.
South Coast's weather impact prompts reduced service for Fall River/New Bedford to aid storm cleanup and essential travel.
MBTA clean-up efforts continue with commuters advised to plan for delays and use caution on platforms and trains.

title: Curran: Patriots could ‘explore options’ to potentially upgrade from Stefon Diggs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots may explore options to replace Stefon Diggs due to his $26.5 million cap hit in 2026.
Diggs, turning 33 in November, wants to stay but faces contract restructuring or release before March 13.
Team could target younger receivers like Alec Pierce or trade for talents such as A.J. Brown.

title: Mass. representatives, including minority whip, to skip State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Several Massachusetts representatives, including House Minority Whip Katherine Clark, plan to boycott the State of the Union address.
Clark criticized Trump's policies on healthcare costs, immigration, and transparency, choosing instead to engage with her constituents.
Senator Ed Markey and Representative Ayanna Pressley will participate in the 'People’s State of the Union' rally as a form of protest.

title: Will Charlie McAvoy, Jeremy Swayman be back in Bruins lineup when they resume play Thursday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' McAvoy and Swayman's return uncertain for Thursday game after Olympic gold win.
McAvoy and Swayman diverted to Miami due to blizzard, attended Trump event in DC.
Bruins sit in final East playoff spot, four points ahead of Columbus, enter Thursday's game.

title: Could Trent Williams suddenly emerge as a free-agent target for Patriots?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots are considering Trent Williams as a potential free-agent to bolster their offensive line.
Trent Williams, 37, has earned five All-Pro nods and holds a 91.5 PFF grade, ranking third among NFL tackles.
San Francisco 49ers may release Williams due to contract disputes, making him a high-profile free agent target.
